column4: Greetings. I no longer have sound, and attempting to force a reload of Alsa, i get this: http://pastebin.com/zm9qCR5c
what does that do?
I tried to setup a dual boot today..messed it up somehow..
can you use pastebin.com and copy all of /boot/grub/grub.cfg into it?
this is the only instance of windows 7   memuentry "Windows 7 (loader) (on /dev/sda2)" { insmod ntfs set root='(hd0,2)' serach --no-floppy --fs-uuid etc...etc"
okay, try this:  'sudo gedit /etc/grub.d/40_custom
let me use pastebin
only problem
you're on a live CD, correct?
this might be easier if I could get a damn connection on this lappy
sorry about the delay, had something to do
so are you re-installing ubuntu, or what is going on?
I installed ubuntu..tried a dual boot
well, there's some reason grub isn't picking up windows. but you can manually add an entry for it
it's just a matter of identifying your windows and plugging it in
mind running me threw this?
that's what i've been trying to do, but we can start at step 1 :P
let me look up one command
back in a few...grabbing some chips..pm me when you get back...
sorry having a hard time finding something
any luck?
